story:
Once upon a time, in a quaint village nestled at the foot of Mount Fuji, there lived a little fox named Koji. Koji was a mischievous fellow who loved exploring the forests and playing tricks on the other animals.

One day, as the sun began to set and the stars started to appear in the night sky, Koji decided to wander deeper into the forest than he had ever gone before. As he explored the darkened woods, he heard a soft rustling sound coming from behind a large oak tree.

Curious, Koji cautiously approached the tree and found a tiny injured bird huddled beneath its branches. The bird had a broken wing and looked very sad and scared. Without hesitation, Koji gently picked up the bird and cradled it in his paws.

Feeling a surge of compassion for the injured creature, Koji decided to take the bird back to his den and care for it. He carefully splinted the bird's wing and made sure it was warm and comfortable. For the next few days, Koji diligently nursed the bird back to health, feeding it seeds and berries that he gathered from the forest.

As the bird grew stronger, it regaled Koji with tales of its adventures flying high above the treetops and visiting far-off lands. The little fox was captivated by the bird's stories and felt a deep sense of friendship and gratitude towards his new companion.

Eventually, the bird's wing healed completely, and it was time for it to take flight once more. Koji watched with a mixture of joy and sadness as the bird soared into the sky, its wings spread wide as it disappeared into the horizon.

From that day on, Koji learned the true meaning of kindness and friendship, and he treasured the memory of the little bird who had touched his heart in ways he never thought possible.

And so, under the watchful gaze of Mount Fuji and the twinkling stars above, Koji drifted off to sleep, his heart full of warmth and gratitude for the magical journey he had embarked upon.

The end. Good night, my little one. Sweet dreams.
